intro: Acrostephanus, commonly known as the goldenrods, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, often yellow or orange inflorescences that bloom in late summer and early autumn. Acrostephanus species are typically found in moist or wet habitats, such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. They have slender, erect stems and linear to lance-shaped leaves. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants in gardens.
